definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
fundamental theorem of algebra (every polynomial has a complex root)
pinyin: dai4 shu4 xue2 ji1 ben3 ding4 li3

sentences.english: Many algebra teachers expressed concern about their use in the low lower grades.
sentences.chinese: 很多代數學老師對低年級學生使用計算器表示了憂慮。

sentences.english: You can’t do a calculus class without first taking (and understanding) an Algebra and a Trigonometry class.
sentences.chinese: 沒有三角學和代數學的知識你不會理解微積分。

sentences.english: I have a math test on algebra tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天我有一個關於代數學的數學考試。

sentences.english: I have never got so far as to understand properly the application of algebra to geometry.
sentences.chinese: 我始終沒有真正地領會代數學在幾何學上的應用。

sentences.english: Now the study of QF rings has been a hotspot in international algebraic world.
sentences.chinese: QF環的研究已成爲近期國際代數學界研究的熱點。

sentences.english: The word algebra comes from the title of this book.
sentences.chinese: “代數學”這個詞就來自於那本書的名字。

sentences.english: It reflects the algebra in other algebraic structure of the basic idea.
sentences.chinese: 它體現了代數學中研究其他代數結構的基本思路。
